moves.1. e4 e5 2. d4 exd4 3. Qxd4 Nc6 4. Qd1 B: This helps protects the h5 pawn,
moves.31. d6 Rb5+: Rd5 32 e7 Rxe7 33 Qxh5 Kg7/g8 Qxg4 and I would be less a rook.
moves.33. d7 Rbxb2+: Q protecting b1, so Rfxb2+ Ka1 Rb1+ Qxb1 Rxb1 Kxb1 and the white pawn promotes next move.
moves.34. Ka1 Rbd2:
This was the key move for me, and not Rbe2 35 Qe8+ Rxe8 36 dxe8=Q+.
As I've lost tempi with that pawn from before this move forced a check with the Q, instead of a check with the promoted Queen (which is countered with Rxd8). The threat is actually Rf1++ instead of Rd1+ Qxd1 (just after the pawn promoted)
moves.35. Qe8+: Only way I also saw it to protect that pawn promotion.
